name: GoogleAIModel

input.content: What does the VPBROADCASTB instruction do?

output:
The VPBROADCASTB instruction broadcasts a byte value to all elements of a destination vector register. It replicates the source operand across all elements of the destination vector register, effectively creating a vector with the same value in each element.

**Syntax:**

```
VPBROADCASTB xmm/ymm/zmm, reg/m8
```

**Arguments:**

* **xmm/ymm/zmm:** Destination vector register (128-bit/256-bit/512-bit)
* **reg/m8:** Source register or memory location containing the byte value to broadcast

**Operation:**

The VPBROADCASTB instruction performs the following operation:

```
for (i = 0; i < vector_length; i++) {
    destination_vector[i] = source_byte;
}
```

**Example:**

The following code broadcasts the byte value 0x10 to all elements of the XMM register xmm1:

```
VPBROADCASTB xmm1, byte [rbx]
```

After executing this instruction, all 16 bytes in xmm1 will contain the value 0x10.
